columns.text: In this exercise, we are to prepare the proforma statements and determine the additional financing needed assuming that the company uses half of the net income to distribute dividends and not having the debt and equity vary with the sales amount.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

Now, let us prepare the pro forma statements using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$38,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$32,600|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$5,400|
|Balance Sheet||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Assets|\$27,300|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Debt|\$6,700|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Equity|\$20,600|

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$43,700}\\
\text{Cost}&\underline{37,582}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{6,118}}}\\
\end{array}$$

The total assets and the total debt and equity does not balance out based on the preceding computations. The increase in the equity which is the cash dividends is also not sufficient to balance the amounts in the balance sheet. Therefore, the company should provide additional equity in the retained earnings.

Now, let us prepare the pro forma balance sheet:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r l r}
\text{Assets}&{\$31,464}&\text{Debt}&{\$4,746}\\
{}&{}&\text{Equity}&\underline{26,718}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{31,464}}}&\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{31,464}}}\\
\end{array}$$
